text: Adam Pompey is a New Zealand professional rugby league footballer who plays as a and er for the New Zealand Warriors in the NRL. ==Background== Pompey was born in Auckland, New Zealand. He attended Wesley College in Auckland. He played in the NRL Under-20s for the Sydney Roosters and, while under contract there, played also for the Roosters' feeder club, the Wyong Roos. ==Career== Pompey made his first grade debut for the Warriors against the Cronulla- Sutherland Sharks in round 18 of the 2019 NRL season. In round 24 2019, Pompey scores his first NRL try in the Warriors 10-31 loss to the South Sydney Rabbitohs at Mt Smart Stadium in Auckland. In round 16 of the 2020 NRL season, Pompey scored two tries in a 36-6 victory over Newcastle at Scully Park in Tamworth. ==References== ==External links== *New Zealand Warriors profile Category:New Zealand rugby league players Category:New Zealand Warriors players Category:Rugby league centres Category:Rugby league wingers Category:New Zealand Māori rugby league players Category:Living people Category:1998 births
title: Adam Pompey
